channel.title: Dazzle Cap Card
channel.description:
Hey Everybody!
I just got a Dazzle Capture Card today, and I am so excited! I am going to start recording all of my gameplay for any game like... MW2, Cod4, RDR, H3, BFBC2. All of those games, but there is one problem...I don't know much about how to use it. I got it up and recording....but the quality is so bad because it only supports AV (red, white, yellow cords). If any of you have a Dazzle can you please lend me your secrets to making the quality better?
Oh and listen how screwed up this is....Earlier today I was owning noobs going 60-12, 71-13. And after I got my Dazzle I wanted to record so bad, so I had to switch it to AV (or 480i compared to HDMI(1080i)). When I turned my recorder on I sucked balllls!!!! I mean like 22-20. I was rage quiting so much lol. So i stopped recording and started doing a lil better like 31-17. Then I switched it back to HDMI and went 50-9. It is so fucking gay. I am never going to record any good gameplay without HDMI lol. Just wanted to tell you all that...
Also I am going to try to get some good vids out on youtube. If any of you all want to see any go to DiverseGamingChannel. There should be atleast one vid up tomorrow.

item.title: Dazzle Cap Card
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

lol thanks for the help you all, but I meant when I am recording I just suck…soo today I stopped recording for a couple games, and then I started owning…It is so wierd how I do that lol.[quote=“lesterknome, post:9, topic:350469”]Hehehehe… You’ve asked the right person >: D

  1. Download the pro version of dazzle studio and record in the best quality you can. Remember the least amount of transformers and shit you have the better the quality.

  2. Render the video in sony vegas. If you want the settings i use pm. Also crop out the video cause dazzle has some shit on the top left of the screen.

  3. If you want editing and shit. RE-RENDER THE VIDEO. You should re-render each xbox clip by themselves.

PM if you need more help (I use AV cables and my quality is epic [Fuzzy do to transformer use])[/quote]

Thanks! I will try it all tomorrow when I have more time

Read full topic

item.title: Dazzle Cap Card
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Actually, if you do bad while recording, it may because you’re watching on the computer. I got my EasyCap today and started recording and tried to play on my computer, which was a horrible decision. There is a slight amount of lag between the XBox and the video you get on your computer, so you end up turning more than you do or shooting too late.

Read full topic

item.title: Dazzle Cap Card
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

Hehehehe… You’ve asked the right person >: D

  1. Download the pro version of dazzle studio and record in the best quality you can. Remember the least amount of transformers and shit you have the better the quality.

  2. Render the video in sony vegas. If you want the settings i use pm. Also crop out the video cause dazzle has some shit on the top left of the screen.

  3. If you want editing and shit. RE-RENDER THE VIDEO. You should re-render each xbox clip by themselves.

PM if you need more help (I use AV cables and my quality is epic [Fuzzy do to transformer use])

Read full topic

item.title: Dazzle Cap Card
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Render your video in vegas. I bought dazzle not too long ago and It came with pinnacle studio 14 so thats what i use to capture. I just messed with some of the settings and watched some youtube videos of what to do but I did have a problem where the video was going faster than the sound so I had to reset my settings and it was fine. Also I use red white yellow choords but the quality is great.

Read full topic

item.title: Dazzle Cap Card
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

All I can say is. “Blackmagic: Intensity Pro”

Read full topic

item.title: Dazzle Cap Card
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Well the Dazzle’s quality sucks, so thats probably why you aren’t doing as well. I’m getting an Easycap DC60+ soon for $10, and its quality is a lot better if you know what settings to put it on. I also have RCA cables that have two male ends, so I will be able to play on my TV while recording on my computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Dazzle Cap Card
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Can your console output via HDMI and AV cables at the same time? If so you could play on your HDMI TV and still record at lower quality on your computer.

Oh wait!..Yes, I think it can. It sounds to me like I can do that by just plugging both cords in and keeping the channel on HDMI. SWeet dude! Thanks!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Dazzle Cap Card
item.dc:creator: @Pigrear Pigrear
item.description:
@Pigrear wrote:

I’m pretty sure they can. Would most likely solve your problem, unless its just that you cant handle the pressure of recording. xD

Read full topic

item.description:
